gmmaker > platform

platform 

interface platform

Definition of a platform.

Summary

Properties from platform

number
a

Angle in degrees of the platform.
number
ad

The amount of angular drag on the platform.
number
av

Angular velocity of the platform.
boolean
bu

true if this platform has bullet physics (Anti Tunnel), false otherwise.
platformForces
cf

Object that contains the values of the three forces that get constantly applied to the platform: Apply Force X (cf.x), Apply Force Y (cf.y) and Apply Torque (cf.ct).
number
de

Density of the platform.
boolean
f_1

true if this platform can collide with group A, false otherwise.
boolean
f_2

true if this platform can collide with group B, false otherwise.
boolean
f_3

true if this platform can collide with group C, false otherwise.
boolean
f_4

true if this platform can collide with group D, false otherwise.
1 | 2 | 3 | 4
f_c

The collision group of the platform.
boolean
f_p

true if this platform can collide with players, false otherwise.
boolean
fr

true if this platform has a fixed rotation, false otherwise.
number
fric

Friction of the platform surface.
boolean
fricp

true if this platform can apply friction on players (Fric players), false otherwise.
platformForceField
fz

Object that contains the force zone/field properties of this platform.
number
ld

The amount of linear drag on the platform.
vector2d
lv

Linear velocity of the platform, as a 2d vector.
vector2d
p

Position of the platform, as a 2d vector.
number
re

Restitution (bounciness) of the platform.
physShapeList
shapes

Array that contains the shapes that constitute the platform.
"s" | "k" | "d"
type

Platform type.
boolean
visible

Determines whether the platform is visible or not.

platformForces

boolean

f_c gmm.d.ts:350 
f_c: 1 | 2 | 3 | 4

1 | 2 | 3 | 4

The collision group of the platform.

Instead of being represented by a letter, here it's represented by a number. That way, collision groups A-D are represented by numbers 1-4.

f_p gmm.d.ts:357 
f_p: boolean

boolean

true if this platform can collide with players, false otherwise.

fr gmm.d.ts:327 
fr: boolean

boolean

true if this platform has a fixed rotation, false otherwise.

fric gmm.d.ts:307 
fric: number

number

Friction of the platform surface.

fricp gmm.d.ts:303 
fricp: boolean

boolean

true if this platform can apply friction on players (Fric players), false otherwise.

fz gmm.d.ts:339 
fz: platformForceField

platformForceField

Object that contains the force zone/field properties of this platform.

ld: number

number

The amount of linear drag on the platform.

lv gmm.d.ts:289 
lv: vector2d

vector2d

Linear velocity of the platform, as a 2d vector.

Read more about vectors here.

p gmm.d.ts:283 
p: vector2d

vector2d

Position of the platform, as a 2d vector.

Read more about vectors here.

re gmm.d.ts:315 
re: number

number

Restitution (bounciness) of the platform.

shapes gmm.d.ts:343 
shapes: physShapeList

physShapeList

Array that contains the shapes that constitute the platform.

NOTE: This is not an ordinary array! You can't manually add or remove shapes from this object. You must use the game.world.addShapeToPlat and game.world.removeShapeFromPlat methods.

type gmm.d.ts:274 
type: "s" | "k" | "d"

"s" | "k" | "d"

Platform type.

Can be:

  • "s": Stationary,
  • "k": Kinematic,
  • "d": Dynamic (Free Moving).
visible gmm.d.ts:377 
visible: boolean

boolean

Determines whether the platform is visible or not.
